channel.title: I need help with something so small its stupid [pi]
channel.description:
In the commands.java in order to make a mod be able to do a command it would be ifcomand yada yada yada yada ) && c.playerRights == 1).
Well for some weird reason that just messes the whole command up. Could someone help me out or should I post an example command?

item.title: I need help with something so small its stupid [pi]
item.dc:creator: @xmonster xmonster
item.description:
@xmonster wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:4, topic:418478”][code]

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) && (c.playerRights <= 2) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 25000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			} 
			}

[/code]

When i compiled after using the && c/playerRights == 2) it didnt give me and errors :@[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with something so small its stupid [pi]

item.title: I need help with something so small its stupid [pi]
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:


 if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")){ 
				try {
					String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3) {
						int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
						int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
						if ((newItemID <= 25000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
							c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
						} else {
							c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
						}
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
				} 
				}

When i compiled after using the && c/playerRights == 2) it didnt give me and errors :@

Read full topic
